items.content_html: Do you let any website give you push notifications? I see requests so often and I‚Äôm wondering if anyone actually accepts (and if there are any occasions when it might even be good!) The only one I can imagine ever accepting is my favourite blog and even then I‚Äôd prefer RSS.

Do by Friday takes on GTD - Early Beta üéß

This episode was a truly great one and while humors, it‚Äôs a great overview of some key (and useful) GTD principles. I‚Äôve just scheduled a weekly review for the end of the work day AND I‚Äôm planning a mind dump as well.

items.title: Cognitive Dissonance for Marketing üîó
items.content_html:
Cognitive Dissonance

It has also been observed that if a person finds themselves engaging in activities which are in opposition to what they believe, they will be more willing to change their belief or adopt new beliefs to suit the situation, rather than change their actions.

I‚Äôm researching for an article and this statement really struck me. People will change their beliefs to match their actions more than change their actions.

items.title: Reading Aloud - Austin Kleon üîó
items.content_html:
Reading aloud

I find that reading my work aloud makes it weird enough that I can‚Äôt scan or gloss over anything. Reading to an audience is best, because you start really judging the thing when you have to project it into a room full of people. Quentin Tarantino says he likes to read his scripts to his friends, not for their feedback, but their presence. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want input, I don‚Äôt want you to tell me if I‚Äôm doing anything wrong, heavens forbid,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúBut I write a scene, and I think I‚Äôve heard it as much as I can, but then when I read it to you ‚Ä¶ I hear it through your ears, and it lets me know I‚Äôm on the right track.‚Äù

I use this trick with proofreading texts. Sometimes I have to look at the same thing that‚Äôs been sent back and forth about five times, often with a minor change introduced that is easily missed. Reading aloud is one of the only ways to keep my eyes fresh.

Me: Well I don‚Äôt think these iPhone speak to me.

Me five minutes later: That‚Äôs it! I‚Äôm definitely getting the iPhone Xs

Me another five minutes later: Hum, maybe the iPhone Xr is a real bargain‚Ä¶

repeat.

items.title: What makes a good blog - Merlin Mann
items.content_html:
What makes a good blog?

As I think about the blogs I‚Äôve returned to over the years ‚Äì and the increasingly few new ones that really grab my attention ‚Äì I want to start with, ironically enough, a list. Here‚Äôs what I think helps make for a good blog.

  • Merlin Mann

I just discovered this thanks to @ismh ‚Äòs ten years of 512 pixels post and I‚Äôd say every bit of it still applies today. Both posts are worth reading.

items.title: Hoping to Be Delighted by Apple
items.content_html:
Well it‚Äôs Apple iPhone event day and I feel conflicted.

I‚Äôm really ready for a phone upgrade, I want to pass my current phone on to my wife1 so we can share Live Photos of my daughter, plus then she won‚Äôt have a terrible battery life. But I feel a bit nervous. I‚Äôm worried Apple won‚Äôt give me a reason to upgrade today.

It‚Äôs a funny fear to have, that someone won‚Äôt make you want to give them money. No doubt I‚Äôll change my mind as they could probably just release a phone with a new processor and I‚Äôd want to upgrade but at the same time I‚Äôm really not sure where they go next with smartphones.

Personally, I‚Äôm intrigued by the idea of a foldable phone and I suspect something like a Samsung note that can unfold into a small square tablet with stylus could be very interesting. But that doesn‚Äôt seem on the horizon for Apple. Then again it is not unlike Apple to quietly work away at something for a while and then suddenly release it upon the world.

Regardless, I‚Äôll be watching the keynote (or more likely checking the summary afterwards) and hoping that there will be a surprise or two that I don‚Äôt see coming. Apple are often good at delivering those sweet hardware and software features that delight and perhaps the iPhone Xs will see some new delight.

  1. For the record, I‚Äôd buy her a new phone but she is very resistant to spending money on herself.¬†↩
Finished my last notebook last night and starting a new one today. Trying a different (cheaper) brand but designed for sketching. Let‚Äôs see.
So I just set up Microsub on my microblog using aperture and downloaded indigenous on my iPhone. Time to take this baby for a spin.
the Micro Monday cast with @vasta is really interesting and worth considering and reflecting.
How to make a one-page zine Thanks to Austin Kleon for this one. Now I just need to grab some paper and make my zine.
Testing @sharding ‚Äòs emulsify app at one of the spots I pass everyday and find useful for testing contrast. The blacks are crushed a bit more than the default camera app but it has a nice style.

items.title: Education Needs to Be Inconvenient
items.content_html:
Education needs to be inconvenient

Education needs to be inconvenient because it relies on effort and discomfort to move us from where we were to where we want to be. The internet gives us more access than ever, and if we care enough, we can use that convenient access to explore the inconvenient places that we know we should be exploring.

  • Seth Godin

I was trying to write an article and it just wasn‚Äôt coming. The ideas were all jumbled and the thought wasn‚Äôt clear or refined. So I finished, and then ‚Äúpublished‚Äù to DayOne. I love having a place to send writing that isn‚Äôt online for things which are too private or incomplete.
Discussion starter‚Ä¶what is the correct/your way of assembling lasagna? (Yes I just cooked lasagna)

items.title: Protect your attention
items.content_html:
I made this sketch in my commonplace book about a week and a half ago and since then this idea has come up a few times for me (including the latest Episode of Hello Internet . That‚Äôs usually a sign to take notice of an idea, when it keeps coming up. It‚Äôs also part of the value of a commonplace book, you can notice the themes and ideas that come up again and again and see patterns and connections emerging over time.

Attention is one of our most valuable resources and yet nowadays it feels like it‚Äôs given away for so little. Even giving away your Email address for some freebie is an invitation to take some of your attention.

I‚Äôve made a few changes recently to try and protect my attention more but I know that I both don‚Äôt stick to all of those changes and they don‚Äôt go far enough.

  • Focusing on longer and deeper content
  • planning silence
  • limiting disctration time

They‚Äôve all helped but the issue persists. Today I disabled some more notifications, removed another couple of podcasts from my app and finally set some limits in the new screen time settings in iOS 12. I hope they‚Äôll help, but I know the attitude is the most important step.

items.title: Thai Rolls
items.content_html: I‚Äôd never heard of Thai rolls before but it‚Äôs a type of ice cream that basically gets made in front of your eyes. We went for kinder bueno with coconut pieces. Pretty tasty.
Since my daughter was born there has been a massive increase in my use of Live Photos‚Ä¶ coincidence? I think not.
Looks like you can browse the old discover articles in iOS 12 now.The question is have they restored this feature or is it a beta bug?

A few times I‚Äôve asked a question and people have said ‚Äúhey, where did you find that‚Äù most of the time it‚Äôs from the help page archive well worth a check for little things you may have missed.

I‚Äôve seen a load of articles about ‚ÄúiPad only photo workflows‚Äù where I always think ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll that‚Äôs fine if you take 10 photos‚Äù. This article is the first which I thought would work for a professional. with proper backups and file management.
Last night I found myself playing with halide (as it was very low light). The darkroom integration is pretty interesting so now I‚Äôm checking out this sweet setup post in using halide and darkroom.
Currently Reading : Arbitrary Stupid Goal: Tamara Shopsin üìö

items.title: Steal Like The Decemberists
items.content_html:
Song Exploder - the Decemberists : once in my life

As I was just playing it and playing it over and over again, it reminded me of one of these Yo La Tengo songs called ‚ÄúBarnaby hardly working‚Äù which is one of my favourite songs of all time. So we were playing it live and I felt moved one night to sing the last two lines of ‚ÄúBarnaby hardly working‚Äù, ‚Äúlays down by the river, face down by the river‚Äù.

Colin Meloy

I loved this episode because it‚Äôs such a great example of ‚Äústealing like an artist‚Äù. Referencing the influences that lead to the song but how this diverse group of influences lead to a completely different song that doesn‚Äôt sound like the influences at all.
My Pen Addict Kickstarter kit arrived. Now which pens to fill it with ü§î
